meanings.definition: Playful or frolicsome in a lively or mischievous way.
meanings.sent1: The children had a rompish time playing in the park.
meanings.sent2: Her rompish behavior always brought smiles to those around her.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's rompish antics kept everyone entertained.
meanings.sent4: The rompish kitten chased after shadows in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The rompish laughter of the friends echoed through the meadow.

meanings.definition: Characterized by a carefree and fun-loving attitude.
meanings.sent1: Their rompish spirit made every gathering a joyous occasion.
meanings.sent2: The rompish group danced freely under the starlit sky.
meanings.sent3: The rompish picnic was filled with laughter and good food.
meanings.sent4: Her rompish laughter was contagious, spreading happiness to all.
meanings.sent5: The rompish joy in her eyes was evident to everyone around.

meanings.definition: Behaving in a playful or lively manner.
meanings.sent1: The rompish puppy chased its tail in circles.
meanings.sent2: The children's rompish energy was infectious.
meanings.sent3: His rompish jokes always lightened the mood.
meanings.sent4: The rompish squirrel leaped from tree to tree with glee.
meanings.sent5: The rompish dance troupe captivated the audience with their moves.
